intro: Phaedranassa loxana, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
